API¶

Models¶

Document¶

class document.Document(id, title, description, tags)¶

Document class includes the basic skeleton to keep all the data associated with posts or articles.

description¶

Get description of the document

generate_tokens()¶

Tokenize the document based on selected components (title | description | tags)

id¶

Get id of the document

static set_tokenizer(tokenizer)¶

Set a tokenizer to extract words

Possible tokenizers - semsimilar.core.textprocessor.tokenize.CodeTokenizer, nltk.tokenize.api.*

static set_window(window)¶

Set the size of the window to be used for word sense disambiguation

min value = 2 & must be even number

stemmed_tokens¶

Get stemmed tokens of the document

synset_tokens¶

Get synsets of the tokens (Description is excluded)

synsets¶

Get synsets of the tokens (Description is included)

tags¶

Get tags of the document

title¶

Get title of the document

tokens¶

Get tokens of the document

Here is an example:

Document(101, "PHP Session Security",
"What are some guidelines for maintaining
responsible session security with PHP",
 "<security><php>")

Document Worker¶

document_worker.parallel_process(posts, processors)¶

Process large set of documents using parallel processing

Here is an example:

final_documents, final_texts = parallel_process(new_posts, 3)

Text Processors¶

CodeTokenizer¶

class tokenize.CodeTokenizer¶
tokenize(s)¶

Tokenize a string (Splits the text into words)

Note

Compatible with any tokenizer extending nltk.tokenize.api.TokenizerI

Other¶

processor.remove_stopwords(tokens)¶

Remove stop words in English (e.g. and, of, for, to)

Refer for the full list: http://www.ranks.nl/stopwords

processor.stem_tokens(tokens)¶

Extract the stem of words

wsd.get_synsets(tokens, window)¶

Get synsets for the tokens passed

Semantic Similarity¶

lesk.similarity(documents, new_document, count)¶

Get most similar documents using lexical and string based calculations

Here is an example:

results_ontology = lesk.similarity(documents=topic_documents,
new_document=new_document, count=count)
class hal.HAL(documents)¶
add_document(document)¶

Add document into corpus

static cosine(a, b)¶

Calculate cosine angle between two vectors

create_word_to_word_matrix(documents)¶

Create word to word matrix

document_term_matrix¶

Get document term matrix (TFidf)

get_related_vocabulary(query)¶

Get co-occurring vocabulary

get_term_id(term)¶

Get id of the term in vocabulary

search(query)¶

Get similar documents

threshold¶

Get threshold value for similarity match

word_word_matrix¶

Get word to word matrix

Here is an example:

hal = HAL(documents=final_texts)
main.similarity(documents, new_document, hal_model, count)¶

Get semantically similar documents using both hal and lesk

Here is an example:

similarity(documents, doc, hal, 5)
